metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14295 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: An Integer overflow in the getElfSections function in p_vmlinx.cpp in UPX3.95 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via askewed offset larger than the size of the PE section in a UPX packedexecutable, which triggers an allocation of excessive memory.

criterions.comment: upx-ucl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
